FaqSection.What are the differences between Standar: What are the differences between Standard SMS and Corporate SMS packages?
FaqSection.<b>The Standard SMS</b><br/> package inc:
The Standard SMS
package includes benefits such as cheaper costs of SMS sending, easy SMS sending, reports on SMS sending, a complete set of basic features, and tools for measuring campaign results.
The Corporate SMS
package includes every feature of the Standard SMS package while also providing additional features which are: access to a ready-to-use OTP sending system, credit refunds if the messages fail to reach the recipients, and the ability to check the sending status in a more detailed manner.
FaqSection.Are sending speeds and success rates of: Are sending speeds and success rates of the Standard SMS and Corporate SMS packages different?
FaqSection.Can the sender’s name be set to a custom: Can the sender’s name be set to a custom name?
FaqSection.It is possible. If you wish to set a cus: It is possible. If you wish to set a custom name as the sender’s name, you are required to purchase a package with a minimum price of 3,000 THB and up. The number of custom names allowed depending on the package chosen. The details can be found here: https://www.thaibulksms.com/pricing
FaqSection.Which API languages does ThaiBulkSMS sup: Which API languages does ThaiBulkSMS support?
FaqSection.More than 10 languages are supported inc: More than 10 languages are supported including PHP, Java, Python, and others as listed here:https://frontend.thaibulksms.com/api
FaqSection.Can OTP be delivered to every recipient,: Can OTP be delivered to every recipient, even those who have set their systems to block SMS?
FaqSection.If the customer is using our OTP Ready-t: If the customer is using our OTP Ready-to-Use system, the SMS can be delivered to such recipients. But if the customer is using the customer’s system with custom sender names, a whitelist request must be submitted to allow those custom sender names to be able to reach the numbers which turned on the blocking function.
FaqSection.When encountering an anti-spam system (t: When encountering an anti-spam system (the recipient requested to block SMS from this channel), what can be done about it?
FaqSection.You can contact us to request a whitelis: You can contact us to request a whitelist form for senders. We will then get in touch with the networks. The networks will decide whether a sender can be allowed on the whitelist.
FaqSection.What is the maximum number of characters: What is the maximum number of characters allowed per 1 message, and are there any other restrictions?
FaqSection.For messages in <b>Thai</b>, 70 characte:
For messages in Thai, 70 characters are allowed per 1 credit (1 message)/number. Messages with 71-134 characters cost 2 credits (2 consecutive messages)/number. Messages with 135-201 characters cost 3 credits (3 consecutive messages)/number.
For messages in English, 160 characters are allowed per 1 credit (1 message)/number. Messages with 161-306 characters cost 2 credits (2 messages)/number. Messages with 307-459 characters cost 3 credits (3 messages)/number.
*A message with both Thai and English characters will be counted as a Thai message.
*Caution: if an English message contains special characters that exist in the Thai keyboard, the message will be counted as a Thai message for crediting purposes.
FaqSection.In the event that the end recipient has: In the event that the end recipient has closed their machine, will the message be sent?
FaqSection.The system will continue to Resend until: The system will continue to Resend until the end recipient has opened their machine. If their status has updated, this means that the Resend process has finished, but this cannot be inspected under a Standard SMS package.
